title:
Relativistic spin hydrodynamics with momentum and spin-dependent
  relaxation time
abstract:
Using the extended relaxation time approximation (ERTA) along with the theory
of semi-classical spin, we develop a framework of relativistic dissipative spin
hydrodynamics such that the relaxation time can depend on the momenta and spin
of the constituent spin-1/2 particles. We also consider a general definition of
the fluid four-velocity allowing the theory to be valid in a general frame and
matching conditions. Consequently, we construct the frame-invariant bulk,
shear, particle diffusion, and spin transport coefficients, showing that the
evolution of fluid remains unaffected by spin in the limit of small
polarization as was the case where the relaxation time was independent of spin
or momentum.
